intro: Cracca thurberi, commonly known as Thurber's cracca, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. The leaves are palmately lobed, and the plant is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks.
